newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Meralco 1997 sales growth seen up 9.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Meralco 1997 sales growth seen up 9.5 pct.

text.p: Electricity distributor Manila Electric Co (Meralco) said on Tuesday it expects its sales to grow by at least 9.5 percent this year from a year ago.
In 1996, Meralco reported a 12.2 percent increase in kilowatt-hour sales to 17.81 billion kwhs from 15.88 billion kwhs in 1995.
"We expect our sales to grow by 9.5 percent in 1997 or even better," Meralco president and chief executive officer Manuel Lopez said in a annual letter to shareholders.
Meralco said it expected higher power demand this year on prospects that the country would sustain its solid economic growth of 6.8 percent in 1996.
"We remain optimistic that the country can sustain the economic growth (it) had started and we foresee that this growth will be even better in the Meralco franchise area," Lopez said.
Meralco, the country's largest power distributor, services Metro Manila and nearby provinces.

"We add at least 150,000 customers every year and since the franchise area includes provinces around the urban center of Metro Manila, the growth in customers will continue at a strong level as these areas develop further," Lopez said.
In 1996, Meralco added 208,000 customers, ending the year with 2.9 million customers.
Meralco posted net income of 5.064 billion pesos in 1996 against 4.411 billion the previous year mainly due to higher-than-expected growth in sales.
